intro: Cinchona weddelliana var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and ornamental, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers followed by red, fleshy fruits containing seeds. It is valued for its historical use in the production of quinine, though its medicinal applications are less prominent today. Due to its ornamental qualities and ecological significance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
